verses.text: Cast away from you all your transgressions in which you have transgressed; and make yourself a new heart and a new spirit. For why will you die, house of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have no pleasure in the death of him who dies,” says the Lord Yahweh. “Therefore turn yourselves, and live!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover, take up a lamentation for the princes of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and say,
‘What was your mother?
    A lioness.
She couched among lions,
    in the middle of the young lions she nourished her cubs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She brought up one of her cubs.
    He became a young lion.
He learned to catch the prey.
    He devoured men.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Now when she saw that she had waited,
    and her hope was lost,
then she took another of her cubs,
    and made him a young lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He went up and down among the lions.
    He became a young lion.
He learned to catch the prey.
    He devoured men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He knew their palaces,
    and laid waste their cities.
The land was desolate with its fullness,
    because of the noise of his roaring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the nations attacked him on every side from the provinces.
    They spread their net over him.
    He was taken in their pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They put him in a cage with hooks,
    and brought him to the king of Babylon.
They brought him into strongholds,
    so that his voice should no more be heard on the mountains of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Your mother was like a vine in your blood, planted by the waters.
    It was fruitful and full of branches by reason of many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It had strong branches for the scepters of those who ruled.
    Their stature was exalted among the thick boughs.
They were seen in their height
    with the multitude of their branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But it was plucked up in fury.
    It was cast down to the ground,
and the east wind dried up its fruit.
    Its strong branches were broken off and withered.
    The fire consumed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now it is planted in the wilderness,
    in a dry and thirsty land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire has gone out of its branches.
    It has devoured its fruit,
    so that there is in it no strong branch to be a scepter to rule.’
This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the seventh year, in the fifth month, the tenth day of the month, some of the elders of Israel came to inquire of Yahweh, and sat before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel, and tell them, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Is it to inquire of me that you have come? As I live,” says the Lord Yahweh, “I will not be inquired of by you.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Will you judge them, son of man? Will you judge them? Cause them to know the abominations of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “In the day when I chose Israel, and swore to the offspring of the house of Jacob, and made myself known to them in the land of Egypt, when I swore to them, saying, ‘I am Yahweh your God;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in that day I swore to them to bring them out of the land of Egypt into a land that I had searched out for them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to them, ‘Each of you throw away the abominations of his eyes. Don’t defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt. I am Yahweh your God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“But they rebelled against me and wouldn’t listen to me. They didn’t all throw away the abominations of their eyes. They also didn’t forsake the idols of Egypt. Then I said I would pour out my wrath on them, to accomplish my anger against them in the middle of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I worked for my name’s sake, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations among which they were, in whose sight I made myself known to them in bringing them out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I caused them to go out of the land of Egypt and brought them into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave them my statutes and showed them my ordinances, which if a man does, he will live in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover also I gave them my Sabbaths, to be a sign between me and them, that they might know that I am Yahweh who sanctifies them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“But the house of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness. They didn’t walk in my statutes and they rejected my ordinances, which if a man keeps, he shall live in them. They greatly profaned my Sabbaths. Then I said I would pour out my wrath on them in the wilderness, to consume them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I worked for my name’s sake, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, in whose sight I brought them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover also I swore to them in the wilderness that I would not bring them into the land which I had given them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they rejected my ordinances, and didn’t walk in my statutes, and profaned my Sabbaths; for their heart went after their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless my eye spared them, and I didn’t destroy them. I didn’t make a full end of them in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to their children in the wilderness, ‘Don’t walk in the statutes of your fathers. Don’t observe their ordinances or defile yourselves with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am Yahweh your God. Walk in my statutes, keep my ordinances, and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make my Sabbaths holy. They shall be a sign between me and you, that you may know that I am Yahweh your God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“But the children rebelled against me. They didn’t walk in my statutes, and didn’t keep my ordinances to do them, which if a man does, he shall live in them. They profaned my Sabbaths. Then I said I would pour out my wrath on them, to accomplish my anger against them in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I withdrew my hand and worked for my name’s sake, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, in whose sight I brought them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover I swore to them in the wilderness, that I would scatter them among the nations and disperse them through the countries,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they had not executed my ordinances, but had rejected my statutes, and had profaned my Sabbaths, and their eyes were after their fathers’ idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover also I gave them statutes that were not good, and ordinances in which they couldn’t live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I polluted them in their own gifts, in that they caused all that opens the womb to pass through the fire, that I might make them desolate, to the end that they might know that I am Yahweh.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, son of man, speak to the house of Israel, and tell them, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Moreover, in this your fathers have blasphemed me, in that they have committed a trespass against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when I had brought them into the land which I swore to give to them, then they saw every high hill and every thick tree, and they offered there their sacrifices, and there they presented the provocation of their offering. There they also made their pleasant aroma, and there they poured out their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to them, ‘What does the high place where you go mean?’ So its name is called Bamah to this day.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore tell the house of Israel, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Do you pollute yourselves in the way of your fathers? Do you play the prostitute after their abominations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you offer your gifts, when you make your sons pass through the fire, do you pollute yourselves with all your idols to this day? Should I be inquired of by you, house of Israel? As I live, says the Lord Yahweh, I will not be inquired of by you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“That which comes into your mind will not be at all, in that you say, ‘We will be as the nations, as the families of the countries, to serve wood and stone.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I live,” says the Lord Yahweh, “surely with a mighty hand, with an outstretched arm, and with wrath poured out, I will be king over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring you out from the peoples, and will gather you out of the countries in which you are scattered with a mighty hand, with an outstretched arm, and with wrath poured out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples, and there I will enter into judgment with you face to face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as I entered into judgment with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so I will enter into judgment with you,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will cause you to pass under the rod, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will purge out from among you the rebels and those who disobey me. I will bring them out of the land where they live, but they shall not enter into the land of Israel. Then you will know that I am Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for you, house of Israel, the Lord Yahweh says: “Go, everyone serve his idols, and hereafter also, if you will not listen to me; but you shall no more profane my holy name with your gifts and with your idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in my holy mountain, in the mountain of the height of Israel,” says the Lord Yahweh, “there all the house of Israel, all of them, shall serve me in the land. There I will accept them, and there I will require your offerings and the first fruits of your offerings, with all your holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will accept you as a pleasant aroma when I bring you out from the peoples and gather you out of the countries in which you have been scattered. I will be sanctified in you in the sight of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will know that I am Yahweh when I bring you into the land of Israel, into the country which I swore to give to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There you will remember your ways, and all your deeds in which you have polluted yourselves. Then you will loathe yourselves in your own sight for all your evils that you have committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will know that I am Yahweh, when I have dealt with you for my name’s sake, not according to your evil ways, nor according to your corrupt doings, you house of Israel,” says the Lord Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward the south, and preach toward the south, and prophesy against the forest of the field in the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell the forest of the south, ‘Hear Yahweh’s word: The Lord Yahweh says, “Behold, I will kindle a fire in you, and it will devour every green tree in you, and every dry tree. The burning flame will not be quenched, and all faces from the south to the north will be burned by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All flesh will see that I, Yahweh, have kindled it. It will not be quenched.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Ah Lord Yahweh! They say of me, ‘Isn’t he a speaker of parables?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward Jerusalem, and preach toward the sanctuaries, and prophesy against the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell the land of Israel, ‘Yahweh says: “Behold, I am against you, and will draw my sword out of its sheath, and will cut off from you the righteous and the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing then that I will cut off from you the righteous and the wicked, therefore my sword will go out of its sheath against all flesh from the south to the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All flesh will know that I, Yahweh, have drawn my sword out of its sheath. It will not return any more.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore sigh, you son of man. You shall sigh before their eyes with a broken heart and with bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be, when they ask you, ‘Why do you sigh?’ that you shall say, ‘Because of the news, for it comes! Every heart will melt, all hands will be feeble, every spirit will faint, and all knees will be weak as water. Behold, it comes, and it shall be done, says the Lord Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, prophesy, and say, ‘Yahweh says:
“A sword! A sword!
    It is sharpened,
    and also polished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is sharpened that it may make a slaughter.
    It is polished that it may be as lightning.
Should we then make mirth?
    The rod of my son condemns every tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is given to be polished,
    that it may be handled.
The sword is sharpened.
    Yes, it is polished
    to give it into the hand of the killer.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cry and wail, son of man;
    for it is on my people.
    It is on all the princes of Israel.
They are delivered over to the sword with my people.
    Therefore beat your thigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For there is a trial. What if even the rod that condemns will be no more?” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You therefore, son of man, prophesy,
    and strike your hands together.
Let the sword be doubled the third time,
    the sword of the fatally wounded.
It is the sword of the great one who is fatally wounded,
    which enters into their rooms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have set the threatening sword against all their gates,
    that their heart may melt,
    and their stumblings be multiplied.
Ah! It is made as lightning.
    It is pointed for slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gather yourselves together.
    Go to the right.
Set yourselves in array.
    Go to the left,
    wherever your face is set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also strike my hands together,
    and I will cause my wrath to rest.
    I, Yahweh, have spoken it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me again, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also, you son of man, appoint two ways, that the sword of the king of Babylon may come. They both will come out of one land, and mark out a place. Mark it out at the head of the way to the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall appoint a way for the sword to come to Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and to Judah in Jerusalem the fortified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination. He shook the arrows back and forth. He consulted the teraphim. He looked in the liver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his right hand was the lot for Jerusalem, to set battering rams, to open the mouth in the slaughter, to lift up the voice with shouting, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up mounds, and to build forts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be to them as a false divination in their sight, who have sworn oaths to them; but he brings iniquity to memory, that they may be taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Because you have caused your iniquity to be remembered, in that your transgressions are uncovered, so that in all your doings your sins appear; because you have come to memory, you will be taken with the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You, deadly wounded wicked one, the prince of Israel, whose day has come, in the time of the iniquity of the end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord Yahweh says: “Remove the turban, and take off the crown. This will not be as it was. Exalt that which is low, and humble that which is high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will overturn, overturn, overturn it. This also will be no more, until he comes whose right it is; and I will give it.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You, son of man, prophesy and say, ‘The Lord Yahweh says this concerning the children of Ammon, and concerning their reproach:
“A sword! A sword is drawn!
    It is polished for the slaughter,
to cause it to devour,
    that it may be as lightning;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Cause it to return into its sheath.
    In the place where you were created,
    in the land of your birth, I will judge you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pour out my indignation on you.
    I will blow on you with the fire of my wrath.
I will deliver you into the hand of brutish men,
    skillful to destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be for fuel to the fire.
    Your blood will be in the middle of the land.
You will be remembered no more;
    for I, Yahweh, have spoken it.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, son of man, will you judge? Will you judge the bloody city? Then cause her to know all her abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall say, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “A city that sheds blood within herself, that her time may come, and that makes idols against herself to defile her!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have become guilty in your blood that you have shed, and are defiled in your idols which you have made! You have caused your days to draw near, and have come to the end of your years. Therefore I have made you a reproach to the nations, and a mocking to all the countries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are near and those who are far from you will mock you, you infamous one, full of tumult.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Behold, the princes of Israel, everyone according to his power, have been in you to shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In you have they treated father and mother with contempt. Among you they have oppressed the foreigner. In you they have wronged the fatherless and the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have despised my holy things, and have profaned my Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slanderous men have been in you to shed blood. In you they have eaten on the mountains. They have committed lewdness among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In you have they uncovered their fathers’ nakedness. In you have they humbled her who was unclean in her impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One has committed abomination with his neighbor’s wife, and another has lewdly defiled his daughter-in-law. Another in you has humbled his sister, his father’s daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In you have they taken bribes to shed blood. You have taken interest and increase, and you have greedily gained of your neighbors by oppression, and have forgotten me,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Behold, therefore I have struck my hand at your dishonest gain which you have made, and at the blood which has been shed within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can your heart endure, or can your hands be strong, in the days that I will deal with you? I, Yahweh, have spoken it, and will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter you among the nations, and disperse you through the countries. I will purge your filthiness out of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be profaned in yourself in the sight of the nations. Then you will know that I am Yahweh.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, the house of Israel has become dross to me. All of them are bronze, tin, iron, and lead in the middle of the furnace. They are the dross of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Because you have all become dross, therefore, behold, I will gather you into the middle of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they gather silver, bronze, iron, lead, and tin into the middle of the furnace, to blow the fire on it, to melt it, so I will gather you in my anger and in my wrath, and I will lay you there and melt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I will gather you, and blow on you with the fire of my wrath, and you will be melted in the middle of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As silver is melted in the middle of the furnace, so you will be melted in the middle of it; and you will know that I, Yahweh, have poured out my wrath on you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, tell her, ‘You are a land that is not cleansed nor rained on in the day of indignation.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a conspiracy of her prophets within it, like a roaring lion ravening the prey. They have devoured souls. They take treasure and precious things. They have made many widows within it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her priests have done violence to my law and have profaned my holy things. They have made no distinction between the holy and the common, neither have they caused men to discern between the unclean and the clean, and have hidden their eyes from my Sabbaths. So I am profaned among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her princes within it are like wolves ravening the prey, to shed blood and to destroy souls, that they may get dishonest gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her prophets have plastered for them with whitewash, seeing false visions, and divining lies to them, saying, ‘The Lord Yahweh says,’ when Yahweh has not spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of the land have used oppression and exercised robbery. Yes, they have troubled the poor and needy, and have oppressed the foreigner wrongfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I sought for a man among them who would build up the wall and stand in the gap before me for the land, that I would not destroy it; but I found no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I have poured out my indignation on them. I have consumed them with the fire of my wrath. I have brought their own way on their heads,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came again to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, there were two women, the daughters of one mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They played the prostitute in Egypt. They played the prostitute in their youth. Their breasts were fondled there, and their youthful nipples were caressed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their names were Oholah the elder, and Oholibah her sister. They became mine, and they bore sons and daughters. As for their names, Samaria is Oholah, and Jerusalem Oholibah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Oholah played the prostitute when she was mine. She doted on her lovers, on the Assyrians her neighbors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who were clothed with blue—governors and rulers, all of them desirable young men, horsemen riding on horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She gave herself as a prostitute to them, all of them the choicest men of Assyria. She defiled herself with the idols of whomever she lusted after.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She hasn’t left her prostitution since leaving Egypt; for in her youth they lay with her. They caressed her youthful nipples and they poured out their prostitution on her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore I delivered her into the hand of her lovers, into the hand of the Assyrians on whom she doted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These uncovered her nakedness. They took her sons and her daughters, and they killed her with the sword. She became a byword among women; for they executed judgments on her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Her sister Oholibah saw this, yet she was more corrupt in her lusting than she, and in her prostitution which was more depraved than the prostitution of her sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She lusted after the Assyrians, governors and rulers—her neighbors, clothed most gorgeously, horsemen riding on horses, all of them desirable young men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw that she was defiled. They both went the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “She increased her prostitution; for she saw men portrayed on the wall, the images of the Chaldeans portrayed with red,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: dressed with belts on their waists, with flowing turbans on their heads, all of them looking like princes, after the likeness of the Babylonians in Chaldea, the land of their birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as she saw them, she lusted after them and sent messengers to them into Chaldea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Babylonians came to her into the bed of love, and they defiled her with their prostitution. She was polluted with them, and her soul was alienated from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she uncovered her prostitution and uncovered her nakedness. Then my soul was alienated from her, just like my soul was alienated from her sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet she multiplied her prostitution, remembering the days of her youth, in which she had played the prostitute in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She lusted after their lovers, whose flesh is as the flesh of donkeys, and whose issue is like the issue of horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you called to memory the lewdness of your youth, in the caressing of your nipples by the Egyptians because of your youthful breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, Oholibah, the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Behold, I will raise up your lovers against you, from whom your soul is alienated, and I will bring them against you on every side:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, Pekod, Shoa, Koa, and all the Assyrians with them; all of them desirable young men, governors and rulers, princes and men of renown, all of them riding on horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come against you with weapons, chariots, and wagons, and with a company of peoples. They will set themselves against you with buckler, shield, and helmet all around. I will commit the judgment to them, and they will judge you according to their judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set my jealousy against you, and they will deal with you in fury. They will take away your nose and your ears. Your remnant will fall by the sword. They will take your sons and your daughters; and the rest of you will be devoured by the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will also strip you of your clothes and take away your beautiful jewels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus I will make your lewdness to cease from you, and remove your prostitution from the land of Egypt, so that you will not lift up your eyes to them, nor remember Egypt any more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Behold, I will deliver you into the hand of them whom you hate, into the hand of them from whom your soul is alienated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will deal with you in hatred, and will take away all your labor, and will leave you naked and bare. The nakedness of your prostitution will be uncovered, both your lewdness and your prostitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things will be done to you because you have played the prostitute after the nations, and because you are polluted with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have walked in the way of your sister; therefore I will give her cup into your hand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord Yahweh says:
‘You will drink of your sister’s cup,
    which is deep and large.
You will be ridiculed and held in derision.
    It contains much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be filled with drunkenness and sorrow,
    with the cup of astonishment and desolation,
    with the cup of your sister Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will even drink it and drain it out.
    You will gnaw the broken pieces of it,
    and will tear your breasts;
for I have spoken it,’ says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Because you have forgotten me and cast me behind your back, therefore you also bear your lewdness and your prostitution.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said moreover to me: “Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then declare to them their abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have committed adultery, and blood is in their hands. They have committed adultery with their idols. They have also caused their sons, whom they bore to me, to pass through the fire to them to be devoured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover this they have done to me: they have defiled my sanctuary in the same day, and have profaned my Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they had slain their children to their idols, then they came the same day into my sanctuary to profane it; and behold, they have done this in the middle of my house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Furthermore you sisters have sent for men who come from far away, to whom a messenger was sent, and behold, they came; for whom you washed yourself, painted your eyes, decorated yourself with ornaments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sat on a stately bed, with a table prepared before it, whereupon you set my incense and my oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The voice of a multitude being at ease was with her. With men of the common sort were brought drunkards from the wilderness; and they put bracelets on their hands, and beautiful crowns on their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said of her who was old in adulteries, ‘Now they will play the prostitute with her, and she with them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went in to her, as they go in to a prostitute. So they went in to Oholah and to Oholibah, the lewd women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteous men will judge them with the judgment of adulteresses and with the judgment of women who shed blood, because they are adulteresses, and blood is in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Lord Yahweh says: ‘I will bring up a mob against them, and will give them to be tossed back and forth and robbed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The company will stone them with stones and dispatch them with their swords. They will kill their sons and their daughters, and burn up their houses with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Thus I will cause lewdness to cease out of the land, that all women may be taught not to be lewd like you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will recompense your lewdness on you, and you will bear the sins of your idols. Then you will know that I am the Lord Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, in the ninth year, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, write the name of the day, this same day. The king of Babylon drew close to Jerusalem this same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Utter a parable to the rebellious house, and tell them, ‘The Lord Yahweh says,
“Put the cauldron on the fire.
    Put it on,
    and also pour water into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gather its pieces into it,
    even every good piece:
    the thigh and the shoulder.
    Fill it with the choice bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take the choice of the flock,
    and also a pile of wood for the bones under the cauldron.
Make it boil well.
    Yes, let its bones be boiled within it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Therefore the Lord Yahweh says:
“Woe to the bloody city,
    to the cauldron whose rust is in it,
    and whose rust hasn’t gone out of it!
Take out of it piece after piece
    without casting lots for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘“For the blood she shed is in the middle of her.
    She set it on the bare rock.
She didn’t pour it on the ground,
    to cover it with dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That it may cause wrath to come up to take vengeance,
    I have set her blood on the bare rock,
    that it should not be covered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Therefore the Lord Yahweh says:
“Woe to the bloody city!
    I also will make the pile great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Heap on the wood.
    Make the fire hot.
Boil the meat well.
    Make the broth thick,
    and let the bones be burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then set it empty on its coals,
    that it may be hot,
and its bronze may burn,
    and that its filthiness may be molten in it,
    that its rust may be consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “‘“In your filthiness is lewdness. Because I have cleansed you and you weren’t cleansed, you won’t be cleansed from your filthiness any more, until I have caused my wrath toward you to rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“I, Yahweh, have spoken it. It will happen, and I will do it. I won’t go back. I won’t spare. I won’t repent. According to your ways and according to your doings, they will judge you,” says the Lord Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, behold, I will take away from you the desire of your eyes with one stroke; yet you shall neither mourn nor weep, neither shall your tears run down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sigh, but not aloud. Make no mourning for the dead. Bind your headdress on you, and put your sandals on your feet. Don’t cover your lips, and don’t eat mourner’s bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I spoke to the people in the morning, and at evening my wife died. So I did in the morning as I was commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people asked me, “Won’t you tell us what these things mean to us, that you act like this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to them, “Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Speak to the house of Israel, “The Lord Yahweh says: ‘Behold, I will profane my sanctuary, the pride of your power, the desire of your eyes, and that which your soul pities; and your sons and your daughters whom you have left behind will fall by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will do as I have done. You won’t cover your lips or eat mourner’s bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your turbans will be on your heads, and your sandals on your feet. You won’t mourn or weep; but you will pine away in your iniquities, and moan one toward another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Ezekiel will be a sign to you; according to all that he has done, you will do. When this comes, then you will know that I am the Lord Yahweh.’”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, son of man, shouldn’t it be in the day when I take from them their strength, the joy of their glory, the desire of their eyes, and that whereupon they set their heart—their sons and their daughters—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that in that day he who escapes will come to you, to cause you to hear it with your ears?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day your mouth will be opened to him who has escaped, and you will speak and be no more mute. So you will be a sign to them. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward the children of Ammon, and prophesy against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell the children of Ammon, ‘Hear the word of the Lord Yahweh! The Lord Yahweh says, “Because you said, ‘Aha!’ against my sanctuary when it was profaned, and against the land of Israel when it was made desolate, and against the house of Judah when they went into captivity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I will deliver you to the children of the east for a possession. They will set their encampments in you and make their dwellings in you. They will eat your fruit and they will drink your milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make Rabbah a stable for camels and the children of Ammon a resting place for flocks. Then you will know that I am Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord Yahweh says: “Because you have clapped your hands, stamped with the feet, and rejoiced with all the contempt of your soul against the land of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I have stretched out my hand on you, and will deliver you for a plunder to the nations. I will cut you off from the peoples, and I will cause you to perish out of the countries. I will destroy you. Then you will know that I am Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Because Moab and Seir say, ‘Behold, the house of Judah is like all the nations,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I will open the side of Moab from the cities, from his cities which are on its frontiers, the glory of the country, Beth Jeshimoth, Baal Meon, and Kiriathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the children of the east, to go against the children of Ammon; and I will give them for a possession, that the children of Ammon may not be remembered among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will execute judgments on Moab. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Because Edom has dealt against the house of Judah by taking vengeance, and has greatly offended, and taken revenge on them,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore the Lord Yahweh says, “I will stretch out my hand on Edom, and will cut off man and animal from it; and I will make it desolate from Teman. They will fall by the sword even to Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will lay my vengeance on Edom by the hand of my people Israel. They will do in Edom according to my anger and according to my wrath. Then they will know my vengeance,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Because the Philistines have taken revenge, and have taken vengeance with contempt of soul to destroy with perpetual hostility,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore the Lord Yahweh says, “Behold, I will stretch out my hand on the Philistines, and I will cut off the Cherethites, and destroy the remnant of the sea coast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will execute great vengeance on them with wrathful rebukes. Then they will know that I am Yahweh, when I lay my vengeance on them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the first of the month, Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, because Tyre has said against Jerusalem, ‘Aha! She is broken! She who was the gateway of the peoples has been returned to me. I will be replenished, now that she is laid waste;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore the Lord Yahweh says, ‘Behold, I am against you, Tyre, and will cause many nations to come up against you, as the sea causes its waves to come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will destroy the walls of Tyre, and break down her towers. I will also scrape her dust from her, and make her a bare rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She will be a place for the spreading of nets in the middle of the sea; for I have spoken it,’ says the Lord Yahweh. ‘She will become plunder for the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her daughters who are in the field will be slain with the sword. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Behold, I will bring on Tyre Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, from the north, with horses, with chariots, with horsemen, and an army with many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will kill your daughters in the field with the sword. He will make forts against you, cast up a mound against you, and raise up the buckler against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will set his battering engines against your walls, and with his axes he will break down your towers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By reason of the abundance of his horses, their dust will cover you. Your walls will shake at the noise of the horsemen, of the wagons, and of the chariots, when he enters into your gates, as men enter into a city which is broken open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will tread down all your streets with the hoofs of his horses. He will kill your people with the sword. The pillars of your strength will go down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will make a plunder of your riches and make a prey of your merchandise. They will break down your walls and destroy your pleasant houses. They will lay your stones, your timber, and your dust in the middle of the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cause the noise of your songs to cease. The sound of your harps won’t be heard any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you a bare rock. You will be a place for the spreading of nets. You will be built no more; for I Yahweh have spoken it,’ says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord Yahweh says to Tyre: ‘Won’t the islands shake at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan, when the slaughter is made within you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the princes of the sea will come down from their thrones, and lay aside their robes, and strip off their embroidered garments. They will clothe themselves with trembling. They will sit on the ground, and will tremble every moment, and be astonished at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will take up a lamentation over you, and tell you,
“How you are destroyed,
    who were inhabited by seafaring men,
the renowned city,
    who was strong in the sea,
she and her inhabitants,
    who caused their terror to be on all who lived there!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the islands will tremble in the day of your fall.
    Yes, the islands that are in the sea will be dismayed at your departure.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Lord Yahweh says: ‘When I make you a desolate city, like the cities that are not inhabited, when I bring up the deep on you, and the great waters cover you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will bring you down with those who descend into the pit, to the people of old time, and will make you dwell in the lower parts of the earth, in the places that are desolate of old, with those who go down to the pit, that you be not inhabited; and I will set glory in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you a terror, and you will no more have any being. Though you are sought for, yet you will never be found again,’ says the Lord Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came again to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, son of man, take up a lamentation over Tyre;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and tell Tyre, ‘You who dwell at the entry of the sea, who are the merchant of the peoples to many islands, the Lord Yahweh says:
“You, Tyre, have said,
    ‘I am perfect in beauty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your borders are in the heart of the seas.
    Your builders have perfected your beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have made all your planks of cypress trees from Senir.
    They have taken a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have made your oars of the oaks of Bashan.
    They have made your benches of ivory inlaid in cypress wood from the islands of Kittim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your sail was of fine linen with embroidered work from Egypt,
    that it might be to you for a banner.
    Blue and purple from the islands of Elishah was your awning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your rowers.
    Your wise men, Tyre, were in you.
    They were your pilots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The old men of Gebal
    and its wise men were your repairers of ship seams in you.
All the ships of the sea with their mariners were in you
    to deal in your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘“Persia, Lud, and Put were in your army,
    your men of war.
They hung the shield and helmet in you.
    They showed your beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The men of Arvad with your army were on your walls all around,
    and valiant men were in your towers.
They hung their shields on your walls all around.
    They have perfected your beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Tarshish was your merchant by reason of the multitude of all kinds of riches. They traded for your wares with silver, iron, tin, and lead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Javan, Tubal, and Meshech were your traders. They traded the persons of men and vessels of bronze for your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“They of the house of Togarmah traded for your wares with horses, war horses, and mules.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“The men of Dedan traded with you. Many islands were the market of your hand. They brought you horns of ivory and ebony in exchange.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Syria was your merchant by reason of the multitude of your handiworks. They traded for your wares with emeralds, purple, embroidered work, fine linen, coral, and rubies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Judah and the land of Israel were your traders. They traded wheat of Minnith, confections, honey, oil, and balm for your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Damascus was your merchant for the multitude of your handiworks by reason of the multitude of all kinds of riches, with the wine of Helbon, and white wool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Vedan and Javan traded with yarn for your wares; wrought iron, cassia, and calamus were among your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Dedan was your merchant in precious saddle blankets for riding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Arabia and all the princes of Kedar were your favorite dealers in lambs, rams, and goats. In these, they were your merchants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“The traders of Sheba and Raamah were your traders. They traded for your wares with the best of all spices, all precious stones, and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Haran, Canneh, Eden, the traders of Sheba, Asshur and Chilmad, were your traders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were your traders in choice wares, in wrappings of blue and embroidered work, and in cedar chests of rich clothing bound with cords, among your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘“The ships of Tarshish were your caravans for your merchandise.
    You were replenished
    and made very glorious in the heart of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your rowers have brought you into great waters.
    The east wind has broken you in the heart of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your riches, your wares, your merchandise,
    your mariners, your pilots, your repairers of ship seams,
the dealers in your merchandise,
    and all your men of war who are in you,
with all your company which is among you,
    will fall into the heart of the seas in the day of your ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the sound of the cry of your pilots,
    the pasture lands will shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who handle the oars,
    the mariners and all the pilots of the sea,
    will come down from their ships.
They will stand on the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and will cause their voice to be heard over you,
    and will cry bitterly.
They will cast up dust on their heads.
    They will wallow in the ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will make themselves bald for you,
    and clothe themselves with sackcloth.
They will weep for you in bitterness of soul,
    with bitter mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In their wailing they will take up a lamentation for you,
    and lament over you, saying,
‘Who is there like Tyre,
    like her who is brought to silence in the middle of the sea?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When your wares came from the seas,
    you filled many peoples.
You enriched the kings of the earth
    with the multitude of your riches and of your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the time that you were broken by the seas,
    in the depths of the waters,
    your merchandise and all your company fell within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the inhabitants of the islands are astonished at you,
    and their kings are horribly afraid.
    They are troubled in their face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The merchants among the peoples hiss at you.
    You have come to a terrible end,
    and you will be no more.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came again to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, tell the prince of Tyre, ‘The Lord Yahweh says:
“Because your heart is lifted up,
    and you have said, ‘I am a god,
I sit in the seat of God,
    in the middle of the seas;’
yet you are man,
    and no god,
    though you set your heart as the heart of a god—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
behold, you are wiser than Daniel.
    There is no secret that is hidden from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your wisdom and by your understanding you have gotten yourself riches,
    and have gotten gold and silver into your treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your great wisdom
    and by your trading you have increased your riches,
    and your heart is lifted up because of your riches—”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘therefore the Lord Yahweh says:
“Because you have set your heart as the heart of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore, behold, I will bring strangers on you,
    the terrible of the nations.
They will draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom.
    They will defile your brightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will bring you down to the pit.
    You will die the death of those who are slain
    in the heart of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you yet say before him who kills you, ‘I am God’?
    But you are man, and not God,
    in the hand of him who wounds you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, take up a lamentation over the king of Tyre, and tell him, ‘The Lord Yahweh says:
“You were the seal of full measure,
    full of wisdom,
    and perfect in beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You were in Eden,
    the garden of God.
Every precious stone adorned you:
    ruby, topaz, emerald,
    chrysolite, onyx, jasper,
    sapphire, turquoise, and beryl.
Gold work of tambourines
    and of pipes was in you.
    They were prepared in the day that you were created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You were the anointed cherub who covers.
    Then I set you up on the holy mountain of God.
    You have walked up and down in the middle of the stones of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You were perfect in your ways from the day that you were created,
    until unrighteousness was found in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the abundance of your commerce, your insides were filled with violence,
    and you have sinned.
Therefore I have cast you as profane out of God’s mountain.
    I have destroyed you, covering cherub,
    from the middle of the stones of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your heart was lifted up because of your beauty.
    You have corrupted your wisdom by reason of your splendor.
I have cast you to the ground.
    I have laid you before kings,
    that they may see you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the multitude of your iniquities,
    in the unrighteousness of your commerce,
    you have profaned your sanctuaries.
Therefore I have brought out a fire from the middle of you.
    It has devoured you.
I have turned you to ashes on the earth
    in the sight of all those who see you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All those who know you among the peoples will be astonished at you.
    You have become a terror,
    and you will exist no more.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and say, ‘The Lord Yahweh says:
“Behold, I am against you, Sidon.
    I will be glorified among you.
Then they will know that I am Yahweh,
    when I have executed judgments in her,
    and am sanctified in her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will send pestilence into her,
    and blood into her streets.
The wounded will fall within her,
    with the sword on her on every side.
    Then they will know that I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“There will no longer be a pricking brier to the house of Israel, nor a hurting thorn of any that are around them that scorned them. Then they will know that I am the Lord Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “When I have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and am shown as holy among them in the sight of the nations, then they will dwell in their own land which I gave to my servant Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will dwell in it securely. Yes, they will build houses, plant vineyards, and will dwell securely when I have executed judgments on all those around them who have treated them with contempt. Then they will know that I am Yahweh their God.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Speak and say, ‘The Lord Yahweh says:
“Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt,
    the great monster that lies in the middle of his rivers,
that has said, ‘My river is my own,
    and I have made it for myself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will put hooks in your jaws,
    and I will make the fish of your rivers stick to your scales.
I will bring you up out of the middle of your rivers,
    with all the fish of your rivers which stick to your scales.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll cast you out into the wilderness,
    you and all the fish of your rivers.
You’ll fall on the open field.
    You won’t be brought together or gathered.
I have given you for food to the animals of the earth
    and to the birds of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“All the inhabitants of Egypt will know that I am Yahweh, because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they took hold of you by your hand, you broke and tore all their shoulders. When they leaned on you, you broke and paralyzed all of their thighs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Therefore the Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I will bring a sword on you, and will cut off man and animal from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The land of Egypt will be a desolation and a waste. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.
“‘“Because he has said, ‘The river is mine, and I have made it,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I am against you and against your rivers. I will make the land of Egypt an utter waste and desolation, from the tower of Seveneh even to the border of Ethiopia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No foot of man will pass through it, nor will any animal foot pass through it. It won’t be inhabited for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make the land of Egypt a desolation in the middle of the countries that are desolate. Her cities among the cities that are laid waste will be a desolation forty years. I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘For the Lord Yahweh says: “At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples where they were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will reverse the captivity of Egypt, and will cause them to return into the land of Pathros, into the land of their birth. There they will be a lowly kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be the lowest of the kingdoms. It won’t lift itself up above the nations any more. I will diminish them so that they will no longer rule over the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will no longer be the confidence of the house of Israel, bringing iniquity to memory, when they turn to look after them. Then they will know that I am the Lord Yahweh.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came to pass in the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, in the first day of the month, Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon caused his army to serve a great service against Tyre. Every head was made bald, and every shoulder was worn; yet he had no wages, nor did his army, from Tyre, for the service that he had served against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Behold, I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. He will carry off her multitude, take her plunder, and take her prey. That will be the wages for his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given him the land of Egypt as his payment for which he served, because they worked for me,’ says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In that day I will cause a horn to sprout for the house of Israel, and I will open your mouth among them. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came again to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, prophesy, and say, ‘The Lord Yahweh says:
“Wail, ‘Alas for the day!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the day is near,
    even Yahweh’s day is near.
It will be a day of clouds,
    a time of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sword will come on Egypt,
    and anguish will be in Ethiopia,
    when the slain fall in Egypt.
They take away her multitude,
    and her foundations are broken down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Ethiopia, Put, Lud, all the mixed people, Cub, and the children of the land that is allied with them, will fall with them by the sword.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Yahweh says:
“They also who uphold Egypt will fall.
    The pride of her power will come down.
They will fall by the sword in it from the tower of Seveneh,”
    says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They will be desolate in the middle of the countries that are desolate.
    Her cities will be among the cities that are wasted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will know that I am Yahweh
    when I have set a fire in Egypt,
    and all her helpers are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“In that day messengers will go out from before me in ships to make the careless Ethiopians afraid. There will be anguish on them, as in the day of Egypt; for, behold, it comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘The Lord Yahweh says:
“I will also make the multitude of Egypt to cease,
    by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He and his people with him,
    the terrible of the nations,
will be brought in to destroy the land.
    They will draw their swords against Egypt,
    and fill the land with the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make the rivers dry,
    and will sell the land into the hand of evil men.
I will make the land desolate,
    and all that is therein,
    by the hand of foreigners.
    I, Yahweh, have spoken it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘The Lord Yahweh says:
“I will also destroy the idols,
    and I will cause the images to cease from Memphis.
There will be no more a prince from the land of Egypt.
    I will put a fear in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make Pathros desolate,
    and will set a fire in Zoan,
    and will execute judgments on No.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pour my wrath on Sin,
    the stronghold of Egypt.
    I will cut off the multitude of No.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will set a fire in Egypt
    Sin will be in great anguish.
No will be broken up.
    Memphis will have adversaries in the daytime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young men of Aven and of Pibeseth will fall by the sword.
    They will go into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At Tehaphnehes also the day will withdraw itself,
    when I break the yokes of Egypt there.
The pride of her power will cease in her.
    As for her, a cloud will cover her,
    and her daughters will go into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus I will execute judgments on Egypt.
    Then they will know that I am Yahweh.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt. Behold, it has not been bound up, to apply medicines, to put a bandage to bind it, that it may become strong to hold the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and will break his arms, the strong arm, and that which was broken. I will cause the sword to fall out of his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and put my sword in his hand; but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before the king of Babylon with the groaning of a mortally wounded man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will hold up the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh will fall down. Then they will know that I am Yahweh when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he stretches it out on the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them through the countries. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the third month, in the first day of the month, Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt and his multitude:
‘Whom are you like in your greatness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon
    with beautiful branches,
and with a forest-like shade,
    of high stature;
    and its top was among the thick boughs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters nourished it.
    The deep made it to grow.
Its rivers ran all around its plantation.
    It sent out its channels to all the trees of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore its stature was exalted above all the trees of the field;
    and its boughs were multiplied.
Its branches became long by reason of many waters,
    when it spread them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the birds of the sky made their nests in its boughs.
    Under its branches, all the animals of the field gave birth to their young.
    All great nations lived under its shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The cedars in the garden of God could not hide it.
    The cypress trees were not like its branches.
The pine trees were not like its branches;
    nor was any tree in the garden of God like it in its beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I made it beautiful by the multitude of its branches,
    so that all the trees of Eden,
    that were in the garden of God, envied it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus said the Lord Yahweh: ‘Because he is exalted in stature, and he has set his top among the thick branches, and his heart is lifted up in his height,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will deliver him into the hand of the mighty one of the nations. He will surely deal with him. I have driven him out for his wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foreigners, the tyrants of the nations, have cut him off and have left him. His branches have fallen on the mountains and in all the valleys, and his boughs are broken by all the watercourses of the land. All the peoples of the earth have gone down from his shadow and have left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the birds of the sky will dwell on his ruin, and all the animals of the field will be on his branches,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the end that none of all the trees by the waters exalt themselves in their stature, and don’t set their top among the thick boughs. Their mighty ones don’t stand up on their height, even all who drink water; for they are all delivered to death, to the lower parts of the earth, among the children of men, with those who go down to the pit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord Yahweh says: ‘In the day when he went down to Sheol, I caused a mourning. I covered the deep for him, and I restrained its rivers. The great waters were stopped. I caused Lebanon to mourn for him, and all the trees of the field fainted for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I made the nations to shake at the sound of his fall, when I cast him down to Sheol with those who descend into the pit. All the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, were comforted in the lower parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also went down into Sheol with him to those who are slain by the sword; yes, those who were his arm, who lived under his shadow in the middle of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘To whom are you thus like in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? Yet you will be brought down with the trees of Eden to the lower parts of the earth. You will lie in the middle of the uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword.
“‘This is Pharaoh and all his multitude,’ says the Lord Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, in the first day of the month, “Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Son of man, take up a lamentation over Pharaoh king of Egypt, and tell him,
“You were likened to a young lion of the nations;
    yet you are as a monster in the seas.
You broke out with your rivers,
    and troubled the waters with your feet,
    and fouled their rivers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord Yahweh says:
    “I will spread out my net on you with a company of many peoples.
    They will bring you up in my net.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will leave you on the land.
    I will cast you out on the open field,
and will cause all the birds of the sky to settle on you.
    I will satisfy the animals of the whole earth with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lay your flesh on the mountains,
    and fill the valleys with your height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also water the land in which you swim with your blood,
    even to the mountains.
    The watercourses will be full of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I extinguish you, I will cover the heavens
    and make its stars dark.
I will cover the sun with a cloud,
    and the moon won’t give its light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make all the bright lights of the sky dark over you,
    and set darkness on your land,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will also trouble the hearts of many peoples,
    when I bring your destruction among the nations,
    into the countries which you have not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, I will make many peoples amazed at you,
    and their kings will be horribly afraid for you,
when I brandish my sword before them.
    They will tremble at every moment,
every man for his own life,
    in the day of your fall.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord Yahweh says:
    “The sword of the king of Babylon will come on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cause your multitude to fall by the swords of the mighty.
    They are all the ruthless of the nations.
They will bring the pride of Egypt to nothing,
    and all its multitude will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will destroy also all its animals from beside many waters.
    The foot of man won’t trouble them any more,
    nor will the hoofs of animals trouble them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will make their waters clear,
    and cause their rivers to run like oil,”
    says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When I make the land of Egypt desolate and waste,
    a land destitute of that of which it was full,
when I strike all those who dwell therein,
    then they will know that I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“This is the lamentation with which they will lament. The daughters of the nations will lament with this. They will lament with it over Egypt, and over all her multitude,” says the Lord Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also in the twelfth year, in the fifteenth day of the month, Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, wail for the multitude of Egypt, and cast them down, even her and the daughters of the famous nations, to the lower parts of the earth, with those who go down into the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whom do you pass in beauty? Go down, and be laid with the uncircumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fall among those who are slain by the sword. She is delivered to the sword. Draw her away with all her multitudes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The strong among the mighty will speak to him out of the middle of Sheol with those who help him. They have gone down. The uncircumcised lie still, slain by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Asshur is there with all her company. Her graves are all around her. All of them are slain, fallen by the sword,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose graves are set in the uttermost parts of the pit, and her company is around her grave, all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who caused terror in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is Elam and all her multitude around her grave; all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who have gone down uncircumcised into the lower parts of the earth, who caused their terror in the land of the living, and have borne their shame with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have made Elam a bed among the slain with all her multitude. Her graves are around her, all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; for their terror was caused in the land of the living, and they have borne their shame with those who go down to the pit. He is put among those who are slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is Meshech, Tubal, and all their multitude. Their graves are around them, all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; for they caused their terror in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will not lie with the mighty who are fallen of the uncircumcised, who have gone down to Sheol with their weapons of war and have laid their swords under their heads. Their iniquities are on their bones; for they were the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But you will be broken among the uncircumcised, and will lie with those who are slain by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is Edom, her kings, and all her princes, who in their might are laid with those who are slain by the sword. They will lie with the uncircumcised, and with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There are the princes of the north, all of them, and all the Sidonians, who have gone down with the slain. They are put to shame in the terror which they caused by their might. They lie uncircumcised with those who are slain by the sword, and bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Pharaoh will see them and will be comforted over all his multitude, even Pharaoh and all his army, slain by the sword,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For I have put his terror in the land of the living. He will be laid among the uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword, even Pharaoh and all his multitude,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, speak to the children of your people, and tell them, ‘When I bring the sword on a land, and the people of the land take a man from among them, and set him for their watchman,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if, when he sees the sword come on the land, he blows the trumpet and warns the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then whoever hears the sound of the trumpet and doesn’t heed the warning, if the sword comes and takes him away, his blood will be on his own head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He heard the sound of the trumpet and didn’t take warning. His blood will be on him; whereas if he had heeded the warning, he would have delivered his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the watchman sees the sword come and doesn’t blow the trumpet, and the people aren’t warned, and the sword comes and takes any person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity, but his blood I will require at the watchman’s hand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you, son of man, I have set you a watchman to the house of Israel. Therefore hear the word from my mouth, and give them warnings from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I tell the wicked, ‘O wicked man, you will surely die,’ and you don’t speak to warn the wicked from his way, that wicked man will die in his iniquity, but I will require his blood at your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, if you warn the wicked of his way to turn from it, and he doesn’t turn from his way; he will die in his iniquity, but you have delivered your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, son of man, tell the house of Israel: ‘You say this, “Our transgressions and our sins are on us, and we pine away in them. How then can we live?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them, ‘“As I live,” says the Lord Yahweh, “I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but that the wicked turn from his way and live. Turn, turn from your evil ways! For why will you die, house of Israel?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, son of man, tell the children of your people, ‘The righteousness of the righteous will not deliver him in the day of his disobedience. And as for the wickedness of the wicked, he will not fall by it in the day that he turns from his wickedness; neither will he who is righteous be able to live by it in the day that he sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I tell the righteous that he will surely live, if he trusts in his righteousness and commits iniquity, none of his righteous deeds will be remembered; but he will die in his iniquity that he has committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, when I say to the wicked, “You will surely die,” if he turns from his sin and does that which is lawful and right,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if the wicked restore the pledge, give again that which he had taken by robbery, walk in the statutes of life, committing no iniquity, he will surely live. He will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of his sins that he has committed will be remembered against him. He has done that which is lawful and right. He will surely live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Yet the children of your people say, “The way of the Lord is not fair;” but as for them, their way is not fair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the righteous turns from his righteousness and commits iniquity, he will even die therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wicked turns from his wickedness and does that which is lawful and right, he will live by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
