verses.text: Yet you say, “The way of the Lord is not fair.” House of Israel, I will judge every one of you after his ways.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, one who had escaped out of Jerusalem came to me, saying, “The city has been defeated!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Yahweh’s hand had been on me in the evening, before he who had escaped came; and he had opened my mouth until he came to me in the morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no longer mute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, those who inhabit the waste places in the land of Israel speak, saying, ‘Abraham was one, and he inherited the land; but we are many. The land is given us for inheritance.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore tell them, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “You eat with the blood, and lift up your eyes to your idols, and shed blood. So should you possess the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You stand on your sword, you work abomination, and every one of you defiles his neighbor’s wife. So should you possess the land?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall tell them, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “As I live, surely those who are in the waste places will fall by the sword. I will give whoever is in the open field to the animals to be devoured, and those who are in the strongholds and in the caves will die of the pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make the land a desolation and an astonishment. The pride of her power will cease. The mountains of Israel will be desolate, so that no one will pass through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will know that I am Yahweh, when I have made the land a desolation and an astonishment because of all their abominations which they have committed.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, the children of your people talk about you by the walls and in the doors of the houses, and speak to one another, everyone to his brother, saying, ‘Please come and hear what the word is that comes out from Yahweh.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They come to you as the people come, and they sit before you as my people, and they hear your words, but don’t do them; for with their mouth they show much love, but their heart goes after their gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, you are to them as a very lovely song of one who has a pleasant voice, and can play well on an instrument; for they hear your words, but they don’t do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When this comes to pass—behold, it comes—then they will know that a prophet has been among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel. Prophesy, and tell them, even the shepherds, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Woe to the shepherds of Israel who feed themselves! Shouldn’t the shepherds feed the sheep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You eat the fat. You clothe yourself with the wool. You kill the fatlings, but you don’t feed the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You haven’t strengthened the diseased. You haven’t healed that which was sick. You haven’t bound up that which was broken. You haven’t brought back that which was driven away. You haven’t sought that which was lost, but you have ruled over them with force and with rigor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were scattered, because there was no shepherd. They became food to all the animals of the field, and were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sheep wandered through all the mountains and on every high hill. Yes, my sheep were scattered on all the surface of the earth. There was no one who searched or sought.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Therefore, you shepherds, hear Yahweh’s word:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live,” says the Lord Yahweh, “surely because my sheep became a prey, and my sheep became food to all the animals of the field, because there was no shepherd, and my shepherds didn’t search for my sheep, but the shepherds fed themselves, and didn’t feed my sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, you shepherds, hear Yahweh’s word!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I am against the shepherds. I will require my sheep at their hand, and cause them to cease from feeding the sheep. The shepherds won’t feed themselves any more. I will deliver my sheep from their mouth, that they may not be food for them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘For the Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I myself, even I, will search for my sheep, and will seek them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a shepherd seeks out his flock in the day that he is among his sheep that are scattered abroad, so I will seek out my sheep. I will deliver them out of all places where they have been scattered in the cloudy and dark day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring them out from the peoples, and gather them from the countries, and will bring them into their own land. I will feed them on the mountains of Israel, by the watercourses, and in all the inhabited places of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will feed them with good pasture, and their fold will be on the mountains of the height of Israel. There they will lie down in a good fold. They will feed on rich pasture on the mountains of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will be the shepherd of my sheep, and I will cause them to lie down,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will seek that which was lost, and will bring back that which was driven away, and will bind up that which was broken, and will strengthen that which was sick; but I will destroy the fat and the strong. I will feed them in justice.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, O my flock, the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Behold, I judge between sheep and sheep, the rams and the male goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does it seem a small thing to you to have fed on the good pasture, but you must tread down with your feet the residue of your pasture? And to have drunk of the clear waters, but must you foul the residue with your feet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for my sheep, they eat that which you have trodden with your feet, and they drink that which you have fouled with your feet.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore the Lord Yahweh says to them: ‘Behold, I, even I, will judge between the fat sheep and the lean sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you thrust with side and with shoulder, and push all the diseased with your horns, until you have scattered them abroad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore I will save my flock, and they will no more be a prey. I will judge between sheep and sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set up one shepherd over them, and he will feed them, even my servant David. He will feed them, and he will be their shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Yahweh, will be their God, and my servant David prince among them. I, Yahweh, have spoken it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘I will make with them a covenant of peace, and will cause evil animals to cease out of the land. They will dwell securely in the wilderness and sleep in the woods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them and the places around my hill a blessing. I will cause the shower to come down in its season. There will be showers of blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tree of the field will yield its fruit, and the earth will yield its increase, and they will be secure in their land. Then they will know that I am Yahweh, when I have broken the bars of their yoke, and have delivered them out of the hand of those who made slaves of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will no more be a prey to the nations, neither will the animals of the earth devour them; but they will dwell securely, and no one will make them afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will raise up to them a plantation for renown, and they will no more be consumed with famine in the land, and not bear the shame of the nations any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will know that I, Yahweh, their God am with them, and that they, the house of Israel, are my people, says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You my sheep, the sheep of my pasture, are men, and I am your God,’ says the Lord Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face against Mount Seir, and prophesy against it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and tell it, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I am against you, Mount Seir, and I will stretch out my hand against you. I will make you a desolation and an astonishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will lay your cities waste, and you will be desolate. Then you will know that I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Because you have had a perpetual hostility, and have given over the children of Israel to the power of the sword in the time of their calamity, in the time of the iniquity of the end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, as I live,” says the Lord Yahweh, “I will prepare you for blood, and blood will pursue you. Since you have not hated blood, therefore blood will pursue you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus I will make Mount Seir an astonishment and a desolation. I will cut off from it him who passes through and him who returns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will fill its mountains with its slain. The slain with the sword will fall in your hills and in your valleys and in all your watercourses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you a perpetual desolation, and your cities will not be inhabited. Then you will know that I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Because you have said, ‘These two nations and these two countries will be mine, and we will possess it,’ although Yahweh was there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, as I live,” says the Lord Yahweh, “I will do according to your anger, and according to your envy which you have shown out of your hatred against them; and I will make myself known among them when I judge you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will know that I, Yahweh, have heard all your insults which you have spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, ‘They have been laid desolate. They have been given to us to devour.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have magnified yourselves against me with your mouth, and have multiplied your words against me. I have heard it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Yahweh says: “When the whole earth rejoices, I will make you desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you rejoiced over the inheritance of the house of Israel because it was desolate, so I will do to you. You will be desolate, Mount Seir, and all Edom, even all of it. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel, and say, “You mountains of Israel, hear Yahweh’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Yahweh says: ‘Because the enemy has said against you, “Aha!” and, “The ancient high places are ours in possession!”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore prophesy, and say, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Because, even because they have made you desolate, and swallowed you up on every side, that you might be a possession to the residue of the nations, and you are taken up in the lips of talkers, and the evil report of the people;”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, you mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord Yahweh: The Lord Yahweh says to the mountains and to the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys, to the desolate wastes and to the cities that are forsaken, which have become a prey and derision to the residue of the nations that are all around;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore the Lord Yahweh says: “Surely in the fire of my jealousy I have spoken against the residue of the nations, and against all Edom, that have appointed my land to themselves for a possession with the joy of all their heart, with despite of soul, to cast it out for a prey.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore prophesy concerning the land of Israel, and tell the mountains, the hills, the watercourses and the valleys, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I have spoken in my jealousy and in my wrath, because you have borne the shame of the nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord Yahweh says: “I have sworn, ‘Surely the nations that are around you will bear their shame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“But you, mountains of Israel, you shall shoot out your branches and yield your fruit to my people Israel; for they are at hand to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, behold, I am for you, and I will come to you, and you will be tilled and sown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will multiply men on you, all the house of Israel, even all of it. The cities will be inhabited and the waste places will be built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will multiply man and animal on you. They will increase and be fruitful. I will cause you to be inhabited as you were before, and you will do better than at your beginnings. Then you will know that I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I will cause men to walk on you, even my people Israel. They will possess you, and you will be their inheritance, and you will never again bereave them of their children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Because they say to you, ‘You are a devourer of men, and have been a bereaver of your nation;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore you shall devour men no more, and not bereave your nation any more,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I won’t let you hear the shame of the nations any more. You won’t bear the reproach of the peoples any more, and you won’t cause your nation to stumble any more,” says the Lord Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, when the house of Israel lived in their own land, they defiled it by their ways and by their deeds. Their way before me was as the uncleanness of a woman in her impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I poured out my wrath on them for the blood which they had poured out on the land, and because they had defiled it with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I scattered them among the nations, and they were dispersed through the countries. I judged them according to their way and according to their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the nations where they went, they profaned my holy name, in that men said of them, ‘These are Yahweh’s people, and have left his land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I had respect for my holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations where they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore tell the house of Israel, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “I don’t do this for your sake, house of Israel, but for my holy name, which you have profaned among the nations where you went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will sanctify my great name, which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned among them. Then the nations will know that I am Yahweh,” says the Lord Yahweh, “when I am proven holy in you before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“For I will take you from among the nations and gather you out of all the countries, and will bring you into your own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be clean. I will cleanse you from all your filthiness and from all your idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also give you a new heart, and I will put a new spirit within you. I will take away the stony heart out of your flesh, and I will give you a heart of flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will put my Spirit within you, and cause you to walk in my statutes. You will keep my ordinances and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will dwell in the land that I gave to your fathers. You will be my people, and I will be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will save you from all your uncleanness. I will call for the grain and will multiply it, and lay no famine on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will multiply the fruit of the tree and the increase of the field, that you may receive no more the reproach of famine among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Then you will remember your evil ways, and your deeds that were not good; and you will loathe yourselves in your own sight for your iniquities and for your abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I don’t do this for your sake,” says the Lord Yahweh. “Let it be known to you. Be ashamed and confounded for your ways, house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “In the day that I cleanse you from all your iniquities, I will cause the cities to be inhabited and the waste places will be built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land that was desolate will be tilled instead of being a desolation in the sight of all who passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will say, ‘This land that was desolate has become like the garden of Eden. The waste, desolate, and ruined cities are fortified and inhabited.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the nations that are left around you will know that I, Yahweh, have built the ruined places and planted that which was desolate. I, Yahweh, have spoken it, and I will do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “For this, moreover, I will be inquired of by the house of Israel, to do it for them: I will increase them with men like a flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the flock for sacrifice, as the flock of Jerusalem in her appointed feasts, so the waste cities will be filled with flocks of men. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s hand was on me, and he brought me out in Yahweh’s Spirit, and set me down in the middle of the valley; and it was full of bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He caused me to pass by them all around; and behold, there were very many in the open valley, and behold, they were very dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?”
I answered, “Lord Yahweh, you know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he said to me, “Prophesy over these bones, and tell them, ‘You dry bones, hear Yahweh’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Yahweh says to these bones: “Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and you will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will lay sinews on you, and will bring up flesh on you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and you will live. Then you will know that I am Yahweh.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I prophesied as I was commanded. As I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold, there was an earthquake. Then the bones came together, bone to its bone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw, and, behold, there were sinews on them, and flesh came up, and skin covered them above; but there was no breath in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “Prophesy to the wind, prophesy, son of man, and tell the wind, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Come from the four winds, breath, and breathe on these slain, that they may live.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood up on their feet, an exceedingly great army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel. Behold, they say, ‘Our bones are dried up, and our hope is lost. We are completely cut off.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore prophesy, and tell them, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, my people; and I will bring you into the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will know that I am Yahweh, when I have opened your graves and caused you to come up out of your graves, my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will put my Spirit in you, and you will live. Then I will place you in your own land; and you will know that I, Yahweh, have spoken it and performed it,” says Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came again to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, son of man, take one stick and write on it, ‘For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions.’ Then take another stick, and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel his companions.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then join them for yourself to one another into one stick, that they may become one in your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the children of your people speak to you, saying, ‘Won’t you show us what you mean by these?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: tell them, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his companions; and I will put them with it, with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they will be one in my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sticks on which you write will be in your hand before their eyes.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I will take the children of Israel from among the nations where they have gone, and will gather them on every side, and bring them into their own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel. One king will be king to them all. They will no longer be two nations. They won’t be divided into two kingdoms any more at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They won’t defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions; but I will save them out of all their dwelling places in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them. So they will be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“My servant David will be king over them. They all will have one shepherd. They will also walk in my ordinances and observe my statutes, and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will dwell in the land that I have given to Jacob my servant, in which your fathers lived. They will dwell therein, they, and their children, and their children’s children, forever. David my servant will be their prince forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them. It will be an everlasting covenant with them. I will place them, multiply them, and will set my sanctuary among them forever more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My tent also will be with them. I will be their God, and they will be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nations will know that I am Yahweh who sanctifies Israel, when my sanctuary is among them forever more.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward Gog, of the land of Magog, the prince of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal, and prophesy against him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I am against you, Gog, prince of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will turn you around, and put hooks into your jaws, and I will bring you out, with all your army, horses and horsemen, all of them clothed in full armor, a great company with buckler and shield, all of them handling swords;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Persia, Cush, and Put with them, all of them with shield and helmet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gomer, and all his hordes; the house of Togarmah in the uttermost parts of the north, and all his hordes—even many peoples with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Be prepared, yes, prepare yourself, you, and all your companies who are assembled to you, and be a guard to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After many days you will be visited. In the latter years you will come into the land that is brought back from the sword, that is gathered out of many peoples, on the mountains of Israel, which have been a continual waste; but it is brought out of the peoples and they will dwell securely, all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will ascend. You will come like a storm. You will be like a cloud to cover the land, you and all your hordes, and many peoples with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “It will happen in that day that things will come into your mind, and you will devise an evil plan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will say, ‘I will go up to the land of unwalled villages. I will go to those who are at rest, who dwell securely, all of them dwelling without walls, and having neither bars nor gates,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to take the plunder and to take prey; to turn your hand against the waste places that are inhabited, and against the people who are gathered out of the nations, who have gotten livestock and goods, who dwell in the middle of the earth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sheba, Dedan, and the merchants of Tarshish, with all its young lions, will ask you, ‘Have you come to take the plunder? Have you assembled your company to take the prey, to carry away silver and gold, to take away livestock and goods, to take great plunder?’”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, son of man, prophesy, and tell Gog, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “In that day when my people Israel dwells securely, will you not know it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will come from your place out of the uttermost parts of the north, you, and many peoples with you, all of them riding on horses, a great company and a mighty army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will come up against my people Israel as a cloud to cover the land. It will happen in the latter days that I will bring you against my land, that the nations may know me when I am sanctified in you, Gog, before their eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Are you he of whom I spoke in old time by my servants the prophets of Israel, who prophesied in those days for years that I would bring you against them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen in that day, when Gog comes against the land of Israel,” says the Lord Yahweh, “that my wrath will come up into my nostrils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in my jealousy and in the fire of my wrath I have spoken. Surely in that day there will be a great shaking in the land of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the animals of the field, all creeping things who creep on the earth, and all the men who are on the surface of the earth will shake at my presence. Then the mountains will be thrown down, the steep places will fall, and every wall will fall to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will call for a sword against him to all my mountains,” says the Lord Yahweh. “Every man’s sword will be against his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will enter into judgment with him with pestilence and with blood. I will rain on him, on his hordes, and on the many peoples who are with him, torrential rains with great hailstones, fire, and sulfur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will magnify myself and sanctify myself, and I will make myself known in the eyes of many nations. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, son of man, prophesy against Gog, and say, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, I am against you, Gog, prince of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will turn you around, will lead you on, and will cause you to come up from the uttermost parts of the north; and I will bring you onto the mountains of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike your bow out of your left hand, and will cause your arrows to fall out of your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will fall on the mountains of Israel, you, and all your hordes, and the peoples who are with you. I will give you to the ravenous birds of every sort and to the animals of the field to be devoured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will fall on the open field, for I have spoken it,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will send a fire on Magog and on those who dwell securely in the islands. Then they will know that I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“I will make my holy name known among my people Israel. I won’t allow my holy name to be profaned any more. Then the nations will know that I am Yahweh, the Holy One in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, it comes, and it will be done,” says the Lord Yahweh. “This is the day about which I have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Those who dwell in the cities of Israel will go out and will make fires of the weapons and burn them, both the shields and the bucklers, the bows and the arrows, and the war clubs and the spears, and they will make fires with them for seven years;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they will take no wood out of the field, and not cut down any out of the forests; for they will make fires with the weapons. They will plunder those who plundered them, and rob those who robbed them,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“It will happen in that day, that I will give to Gog a place for burial in Israel, the valley of those who pass through on the east of the sea; and it will stop those who pass through. They will bury Gog and all his multitude there, and they will call it ‘The valley of Hamon Gog’.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“The house of Israel will be burying them for seven months, that they may cleanse the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, all the people of the land will bury them; and they will become famous in the day that I will be glorified,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“They will set apart men of continual employment who will pass through the land. Those who pass through will go with those who bury those who remain on the surface of the land, to cleanse it. After the end of seven months they will search.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who search through the land will pass through; and when anyone sees a man’s bone, then he will set up a sign by it, until the undertakers have buried it in the valley of Hamon Gog.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hamonah will also be the name of a city. Thus they will cleanse the land.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, son of man, the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Speak to the birds of every sort, and to every animal of the field, “Assemble yourselves, and come; gather yourselves on every side to my sacrifice that I sacrifice for you, even a great sacrifice on the mountains of Israel, that you may eat meat and drink blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat the flesh of the mighty, and drink the blood of the princes of the earth, of rams, of lambs, and of goats, of bulls, all of them fatlings of Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat fat until you are full, and drink blood until you are drunk, of my sacrifice which I have sacrificed for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be filled at my table with horses and charioteers, with mighty men, and with all men of war,” says the Lord Yahweh.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will set my glory among the nations. Then all the nations will see my judgment that I have executed, and my hand that I have laid on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the house of Israel will know that I am Yahweh their God, from that day and forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nations will know that the house of Israel went into captivity for their iniquity, because they trespassed against me, and I hid my face from them; so I gave them into the hand of their adversaries, and they all fell by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did to them according to their uncleanness and according to their transgressions. I hid my face from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore the Lord Yahweh says: ‘Now I will reverse the captivity of Jacob and have mercy on the whole house of Israel. I will be jealous for my holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will forget their shame and all their trespasses by which they have trespassed against me, when they dwell securely in their land. No one will make them afraid
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when I have brought them back from the peoples, gathered them out of their enemies’ lands, and am shown holy among them in the sight of many nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will know that I am Yahweh their God, in that I caused them to go into captivity among the nations, and have gathered them to their own land. Then I will leave none of them captive any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I won’t hide my face from them any more, for I have poured out my Spirit on the house of Israel,’ says the Lord Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twenty-fifth year of our captivity, in the beginning of the year, in the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was struck, in the same day, Yahweh’s hand was on me, and he brought me there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the visions of God he brought me into the land of Israel, and set me down on a very high mountain, on which was something like the frame of a city to the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought me there; and, behold, there was a man whose appearance was like the appearance of bronze, with a line of flax in his hand and a measuring reed; and he stood in the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man said to me, “Son of man, see with your eyes, and hear with your ears, and set your heart on all that I will show you; for you have been brought here so that I may show them to you. Declare all that you see to the house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, there was a wall on the outside of the house all around, and in the man’s hand a measuring reed six cubits long, of a cubit and a hand width each. So he measured the thickness of the building, one reed; and the height, one reed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to the gate which looks toward the east, and went up its steps. He measured the threshold of the gate, one reed wide; and the other threshold, one reed wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every lodge was one reed long and one reed wide. Between the lodges was five cubits. The threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate toward the house was one reed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured also the porch of the gate toward the house, one reed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he measured the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and its posts, two cubits; and the porch of the gate was toward the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The side rooms of the gate eastward were three on this side, and three on that side. The three of them were of one measure. The posts had one measure on this side and on that side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured the width of the opening of the gate, ten cubits; and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a border before the lodges, one cubit on this side, and a border, one cubit on that side; and the side rooms, six cubits on this side, and six cubits on that side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured the gate from the roof of the one side room to the roof of the other, a width of twenty-five cubits, door against door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also made posts, sixty cubits; and the court reached to the posts, around the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the forefront of the gate at the entrance to the forefront of the inner porch of the gate were fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were closed windows to the side rooms, and to their posts within the gate all around, and likewise to the arches. Windows were around inward. Palm trees were on each post.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me into the outer court. Behold, there were rooms and a pavement made for the court all around. Thirty rooms were on the pavement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pavement was by the side of the gates, corresponding to the length of the gates, even the lower pavement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he measured the width from the forefront of the lower gate to the forefront of the inner court outside, one hundred cubits, both on the east and on the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured the length and width of the gate of the outer court which faces toward the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lodges of it were three on this side and three on that side. Its posts and its arches were the same as the measure of the first gate: its length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its windows, its arches, and its palm trees were the same as the measure of the gate which faces toward the east. They went up to it by seven steps. Its arches were before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a gate to the inner court facing the other gate, on the north and on the east. He measured one hundred cubits from gate to gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He led me toward the south; and behold, there was a gate toward the south. He measured its posts and its arches according to these measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were windows in it and in its arches all around, like the other windows: the length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven steps to go up to it, and its arches were before them. It had palm trees, one on this side, and another on that side, on its posts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a gate to the inner court toward the south. He measured one hundred cubits from gate to gate toward the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me to the inner court by the south gate. He measured the south gate according to these measurements;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with its lodges, its posts, and its arches, according to these measurements. There were windows in it and in its arches all around. It was fifty cubits long, and twenty-five cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were arches all around, twenty-five cubits long and five cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its arches were toward the outer court. Palm trees were on its posts. The ascent to it had eight steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought me into the inner court toward the east. He measured the gate according to these measurements;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with its lodges, its posts, and its arches, according to these measurements. There were windows in it and in its arches all around. It was fifty cubits long, and twenty-five cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its arches were toward the outer court. Palm trees were on its posts on this side and on that side. The ascent to it had eight steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought me to the north gate, and he measured it according to these measurements—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: its lodges, its posts, and its arches. There were windows in it all around. The length was fifty cubits and the width twenty-five cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its posts were toward the outer court. Palm trees were on its posts on this side and on that side. The ascent to it had eight steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A room with its door was by the posts at the gates. They washed the burnt offering there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the porch of the gate were two tables on this side and two tables on that side, on which to kill the burnt offering, the sin offering, and the trespass offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the one side outside, as one goes up to the entry of the gate toward the north, were two tables; and on the other side, which belonged to the porch of the gate, were two tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Four tables were on this side, and four tables on that side, by the side of the gate: eight tables, on which they killed the sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were four cut stone tables for the burnt offering, a cubit and a half long, a cubit and a half wide, and one cubit high. They laid the instruments with which they killed the burnt offering and the sacrifice on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hooks, a hand width long, were fastened within all around. The meat of the offering was on the tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Outside of the inner gate were rooms for the singers in the inner court, which was at the side of the north gate. They faced toward the south. One at the side of the east gate faced toward the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “This room, which faces toward the south, is for the priests who perform the duty of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The room which faces toward the north is for the priests who perform the duty of the altar. These are the sons of Zadok, who from among the sons of Levi come near to Yahweh to minister to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured the court, one hundred cubits long and one hundred cubits wide, square. The altar was before the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me to the porch of the house, and measured each post of the porch, five cubits on this side, and five cubits on that side. The width of the gate was three cubits on this side and three cubits on that side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of the porch was twenty cubits and the width eleven cubits, even by the steps by which they went up to it. There were pillars by the posts, one on this side, and another on that side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought me to the nave and measured the posts, six cubits wide on the one side and six cubits wide on the other side, which was the width of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The width of the entrance was ten cubits, and the sides of the entrance were five cubits on the one side, and five cubits on the other side. He measured its length, forty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went inward and measured each post of the entrance, two cubits; and the entrance, six cubits; and the width of the entrance, seven cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured its length, twenty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits, before the nave. He said to me, “This is the most holy place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he measured the wall of the house, six cubits; and the width of every side room, four cubits, all around the house on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The side rooms were in three stories, one over another, and thirty in each story. They entered into the wall which belonged to the house for the side rooms all around, that they might be supported and not penetrate the wall of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The side rooms were wider on the higher levels, because the walls were narrower at the higher levels. Therefore the width of the house increased upward; and so one went up from the lowest level to the highest through the middle level.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw also that the house had a raised base all around. The foundations of the side rooms were a full reed of six great cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thickness of the outer wall of the side rooms was five cubits. That which was left was the place of the side rooms that belonged to the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Between the rooms was a width of twenty cubits around the house on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The doors of the side rooms were toward an open area that was left, one door toward the north, and another door toward the south. The width of the open area was five cubits all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The building that was before the separate place at the side toward the west was seventy cubits wide; and the wall of the building was five cubits thick all around, and its length ninety cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he measured the temple, one hundred cubits long; and the separate place, and the building, with its walls, one hundred cubits long;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also the width of the face of the temple, and of the separate place toward the east, one hundred cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured the length of the building before the separate place which was at its back, and its galleries on the one side and on the other side, one hundred cubits from the inner temple, and the porches of the court,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the thresholds, and the closed windows, and the galleries around on their three stories, opposite the threshold, with wood ceilings all around, and from the ground up to the windows, (now the windows were covered),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the space above the door, even to the inner house, and outside, and by all the wall all around inside and outside, by measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was made with cherubim and palm trees. A palm tree was between cherub and cherub, and every cherub had two faces,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that there was the face of a man toward the palm tree on the one side, and the face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the other side. It was made like this through all the house all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cherubim and palm trees were made from the ground to above the door. The wall of the temple was like this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The door posts of the nave were squared. As for the face of the nave, its appearance was as the appearance of the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The altar was of wood, three cubits high, and its length two cubits. Its corners, its base, and its walls were of wood. He said to me, “This is the table that is before Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The temple and the sanctuary had two doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The doors had two leaves each, two turning leaves: two for the one door, and two leaves for the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were made on them, on the doors of the nave, cherubim and palm trees, like those made on the walls. There was a threshold of wood on the face of the porch outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were closed windows and palm trees on the one side and on the other side, on the sides of the porch. This is how the side rooms of the temple and the thresholds were arranged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me out into the outer court, the way toward the north. Then he brought me into the room that was opposite the separate place, and which was opposite the building toward the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Facing the length of one hundred cubits was the north door, and the width was fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Opposite the twenty cubits which belonged to the inner court, and opposite the pavement which belonged to the outer court, was gallery against gallery in the three stories.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the rooms was a walk of ten cubits’ width inward, a way of one cubit; and their doors were toward the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the upper rooms were shorter; for the galleries took away from these more than from the lower and the middle in the building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they were in three stories, and they didn’t have pillars as the pillars of the courts. Therefore the uppermost was set back more than the lowest and the middle from the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wall that was outside by the side of the rooms, toward the outer court before the rooms, was fifty cubits long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the length of the rooms that were in the outer court was fifty cubits. Behold, those facing the temple were one hundred cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From under these rooms was the entry on the east side, as one goes into them from the outer court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, before the separate place, and before the building, there were rooms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way before them was like the appearance of the rooms which were toward the north. Their length and width were the same. All their exits had the same arrangement and doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like the doors of the rooms that were toward the south was a door at the head of the way, even the way directly before the wall toward the east, as one enters into them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “The north rooms and the south rooms, which are opposite the separate place, are the holy rooms, where the priests who are near to Yahweh shall eat the most holy things. There they shall lay the most holy things, with the meal offering, the sin offering, and the trespass offering; for the place is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priests enter in, then they shall not go out of the holy place into the outer court until they lay their garments in which they minister there; for they are holy. Then they shall put on other garments, and shall approach that which is for the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he had finished measuring the inner house, he brought me out by the way of the gate which faces toward the east, and measured it all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured on the east side with the measuring reed five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured on the north side five hundred reeds with the measuring reed all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured on the south side five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He turned about to the west side, and measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured it on the four sides. It had a wall around it, the length five hundred cubits, and the width five hundred cubits, to make a separation between that which was holy and that which was common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward he brought me to the gate, even the gate that looks toward the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east. His voice was like the sound of many waters; and the earth was illuminated with his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was like the appearance of the vision which I saw, even according to the vision that I saw when I came to destroy the city; and the visions were like the vision that I saw by the river Chebar; and I fell on my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s glory came into the house by the way of the gate which faces toward the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit took me up and brought me into the inner court; and behold, Yahweh’s glory filled the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I heard one speaking to me out of the house, and a man stood by me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “Son of man, this is the place of my throne and the place of the soles of my feet, where I will dwell among the children of Israel forever. The house of Israel will no more defile my holy name, neither they nor their kings, by their prostitution and by the dead bodies of their kings in their high places;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in their setting of their threshold by my threshold and their door post beside my door post. There was a wall between me and them; and they have defiled my holy name by their abominations which they have committed. Therefore I have consumed them in my anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now let them put away their prostitution, and the dead bodies of their kings far from me. Then I will dwell among them forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, son of man, show the house to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities; and let them measure the pattern.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they are ashamed of all that they have done, make known to them the form of the house, its fashion, its exits, its entrances, its structure, all its ordinances, all its forms, and all its laws; and write it in their sight, that they may keep the whole form of it, and all its ordinances, and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the law of the house. On the top of the mountain the whole limit around it shall be most holy. Behold, this is the law of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the measurements of the altar by cubits (the cubit is a cubit and a hand width): the bottom shall be a cubit, and the width a cubit, and its border around its edge a span; and this shall be the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the bottom on the ground to the lower ledge shall be two cubits, and the width one cubit; and from the lesser ledge to the greater ledge shall be four cubits, and the width a cubit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The upper altar shall be four cubits; and from the altar hearth and upward there shall be four horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The altar hearth shall be twelve cubits long by twelve wide, square in its four sides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ledge shall be fourteen cubits long by fourteen wide in its four sides; and the border about it shall be half a cubit; and its bottom shall be a cubit around; and its steps shall look toward the east.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “Son of man, the Lord Yahweh says: ‘These are the ordinances of the altar in the day when they make it, to offer burnt offerings on it, and to sprinkle blood on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall give to the Levitical priests who are of the offspring of Zadok, who are near to me, to minister to me,’ says the Lord Yahweh, ‘a young bull for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take of its blood and put it on its four horns, and on the four corners of the ledge, and on the border all around. You shall cleanse it and make atonement for it that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also take the bull of the sin offering, and it shall be burned in the appointed place of the house, outside of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the second day you shall offer a male goat without defect for a sin offering; and they shall cleanse the altar, as they cleansed it with the bull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have finished cleansing it, you shall offer a young bull without defect and a ram out of the flock without defect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bring them near to Yahweh, and the priests shall cast salt on them, and they shall offer them up for a burnt offering to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Seven days you shall prepare every day a goat for a sin offering. They shall also prepare a young bull and a ram out of the flock, without defect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days shall they make atonement for the altar and purify it. So shall they consecrate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they have accomplished the days, it shall be that on the eighth day and onward, the priests shall make your burnt offerings on the altar and your peace offerings. Then I will accept you,’ says the Lord Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me back by the way of the outer gate of the sanctuary, which looks toward the east; and it was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “This gate shall be shut. It shall not be opened, no man shall enter in by it; for Yahweh, the God of Israel, has entered in by it. Therefore it shall be shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the prince, he shall sit in it as prince to eat bread before Yahweh. He shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate, and shall go out the same way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me by the way of the north gate before the house; and I looked, and behold, Yahweh’s glory filled Yahweh’s house; so I fell on my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “Son of man, mark well, and see with your eyes, and hear with your ears all that I tell you concerning all the ordinances of Yahweh’s house and all its laws; and mark well the entrance of the house, with every exit of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall tell the rebellious, even the house of Israel, ‘The Lord Yahweh says: “You house of Israel, let that be enough of all your abominations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in that you have brought in foreigners, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in my sanctuary, to profane it, even my house, when you offer my bread, the fat and the blood; and they have broken my covenant, to add to all your abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have not performed the duty of my holy things; but you have set performers of my duty in my sanctuary for yourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Yahweh says, “No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into my sanctuary, of any foreigners who are among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“But the Levites who went far from me when Israel went astray, who went astray from me after their idols, they will bear their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they shall be ministers in my sanctuary, having oversight at the gates of the house, and ministering in the house. They shall kill the burnt offering and the sacrifice for the people, and they shall stand before them to minister to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they ministered to them before their idols, and became a stumbling block of iniquity to the house of Israel, therefore I have lifted up my hand against them,” says the Lord Yahweh, “and they will bear their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not come near to me, to execute the office of priest to me, nor to come near to any of my holy things, to the things that are most holy; but they will bear their shame and their abominations which they have committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I will make them performers of the duty of the house, for all its service and for all that will be done therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“But the Levitical priests, the sons of Zadok, who performed the duty of my sanctuary when the children of Israel went astray from me, shall come near to me to minister to me. They shall stand before me to offer to me the fat and the blood,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They shall enter into my sanctuary, and they shall come near to my table, to minister to me, and they shall keep my instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“It will be that when they enter in at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments. No wool shall come on them while they minister in the gates of the inner court, and within.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall have linen turbans on their heads, and shall have linen trousers on their waists. They shall not clothe themselves with anything that makes them sweat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they go out into the outer court, even into the outer court to the people, they shall put off their garments in which they minister and lay them in the holy rooms. They shall put on other garments, that they not sanctify the people with their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“They shall not shave their heads, or allow their locks to grow long. They shall only cut off the hair of their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the priests shall drink wine when they enter into the inner court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not take for their wives a widow, or her who is put away; but they shall take virgins of the offspring of the house of Israel, or a widow who is the widow of a priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall teach my people the difference between the holy and the common, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“In a controversy they shall stand to judge. They shall judge it according to my ordinances. They shall keep my laws and my statutes in all my appointed feasts. They shall make my Sabbaths holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“They shall go in to no dead person to defile themselves; but for father, or for mother, or for son, or for daughter, for brother, or for sister who has had no husband, they may defile themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he is cleansed, they shall reckon to him seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the day that he goes into the sanctuary, into the inner court, to minister in the sanctuary, he shall offer his sin offering,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘They shall have an inheritance: I am their inheritance; and you shall give them no possession in Israel. I am their possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall eat the meal offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering; and every devoted thing in Israel shall be theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first of all the first fruits of every thing, and every offering of everything, of all your offerings, shall be for the priest. You shall also give to the priests the first of your dough, to cause a blessing to rest on your house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests shall not eat of anything that dies of itself or is torn, whether it is bird or animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“Moreover, when you divide by lot the land for inheritance, you shall offer an offering to Yahweh, a holy portion of the land. The length shall be the length of twenty-five thousand reeds, and the width shall be ten thousand. It shall be holy in all its border all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of this there shall be a five hundred by five hundred square for the holy place, and fifty cubits for its pasture lands all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of this measure you shall measure a length of twenty-five thousand, and a width of ten thousand. In it shall be the sanctuary, which is most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a holy portion of the land; it shall be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister to Yahweh. It shall be a place for their houses and a holy place for the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twenty-five thousand cubits in length and ten thousand in width shall be for the Levites, the ministers of the house, as a possession for themselves, for twenty rooms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“You shall appoint the possession of the city five thousand cubits wide and twenty-five thousand long, side by side with the offering of the holy portion. It shall be for the whole house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“What is for the prince shall be on the one side and on the other side of the holy allotment and of the possession of the city, in front of the holy allotment and in front of the possession of the city, on the west side westward, and on the east side eastward, and in length corresponding to one of the portions, from the west border to the east border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the land it shall be to him for a possession in Israel. My princes shall no more oppress my people, but they shall give the land to the house of Israel according to their tribes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “Enough you, princes of Israel! Remove violence and plunder, and execute justice and righteousness! Stop dispossessing my people!” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall have just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, that the bath may contain one tenth of a homer, and the ephah one tenth of a homer. Its measure shall be the same as the homer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The shekel shall be twenty gerahs. Twenty shekels plus twenty-five shekels plus fifteen shekels shall be your mina.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“This is the offering that you shall offer: the sixth part of an ephah from a homer of wheat, and you shall give the sixth part of an ephah from a homer of barley,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the set portion of oil, of the bath of oil, one tenth of a bath out of the cor, which is ten baths, even a homer (for ten baths are a homer),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one lamb of the flock out of two hundred, from the well-watered pastures of Israel—for a meal offering, for a burnt offering, and for peace offerings, to make atonement for them,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All the people of the land shall give to this offering for the prince in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be the prince’s part to give the burnt offerings, the meal offerings, and the drink offerings, in the feasts, and on the new moons, and on the Sabbaths, in all the appointed feasts of the house of Israel. He shall prepare the sin offering, the meal offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, to make atonement for the house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “In the first month, on the first day of the month, you shall take a young bull without defect, and you shall cleanse the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering and put it on the door posts of the house, and on the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and on the posts of the gate of the inner court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall do on the seventh day of the month for everyone who errs, and for him who is simple. So you shall make atonement for the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, you shall have the Passover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day the prince shall prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bull for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven days of the feast he shall prepare a burnt offering to Yahweh, seven bulls and seven rams without defect daily the seven days; and a male goat daily for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall prepare a meal offering, an ephah for a bull, an ephah for a ram, and a hin of oil to an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“In the seventh month, on the fifteenth day of the month, during the feast, he shall do like that for seven days. He shall make the same provision for sin offering, the burnt offering, the meal offering, and the oil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “The gate of the inner court that looks toward the east shall be shut the six working days; but on the Sabbath day it shall be opened, and on the day of the new moon it shall be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prince shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate outside, and shall stand by the post of the gate; and the priests shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, and he shall worship at the threshold of the gate. Then he shall go out, but the gate shall not be shut until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of the land shall worship at the door of that gate before Yahweh on the Sabbaths and on the new moons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The burnt offering that the prince shall offer to Yahweh shall be on the Sabbath day, six lambs without defect and a ram without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the meal offering shall be an ephah for the ram, and the meal offering for the lambs as he is able to give, and a hin of oil to an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day of the new moon it shall be a young bull without defect, six lambs, and a ram. They shall be without defect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall prepare a meal offering: an ephah for the bull, and an ephah for the ram, and for the lambs according as he is able, and a hin of oil to an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the prince enters, he shall go in by the way of the porch of the gate, and he shall go out by its way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“But when the people of the land come before Yahweh in the appointed feasts, he who enters by the way of the north gate to worship shall go out by the way of the south gate; and he who enters by the way of the south gate shall go out by the way of the north gate. He shall not return by the way of the gate by which he came in, but shall go out straight before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prince shall go in with them when they go in. When they go out, he shall go out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“In the feasts and in the appointed holidays, the meal offering shall be an ephah for a bull, and an ephah for a ram, and for the lambs as he is able to give, and a hin of oil to an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the prince prepares a free will offering, a burnt offering or peace offerings as a free will offering to Yahweh, one shall open for him the gate that looks toward the east; and he shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, as he does on the Sabbath day. Then he shall go out; and after his going out one shall shut the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“You shall prepare a lamb a year old without defect for a burnt offering to Yahweh daily. Morning by morning you shall prepare it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall prepare a meal offering with it morning by morning, the sixth part of an ephah, and the third part of a hin of oil to moisten the fine flour; a meal offering to Yahweh continually by a perpetual ordinance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus they shall prepare the lamb, the meal offering, and the oil, morning by morning, for a continual burnt offering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The Lord Yahweh says: “If the prince gives a gift to any of his sons, it is his inheritance. It shall belong to his sons. It is their possession by inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he gives of his inheritance a gift to one of his servants, it shall be his to the year of liberty; then it shall return to the prince; but as for his inheritance, it shall be for his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the prince shall not take of the people’s inheritance, to thrust them out of their possession. He shall give inheritance to his sons out of his own possession, that my people not each be scattered from his possession.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me through the entry, which was at the side of the gate, into the holy rooms for the priests, which looked toward the north. Behold, there was a place on the back part westward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “This is the place where the priests shall boil the trespass offering and the sin offering, and where they shall bake the meal offering, that they not bring them out into the outer court, to sanctify the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me out into the outer court and caused me to pass by the four corners of the court; and behold, in every corner of the court there was a court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the four corners of the court there were courts enclosed, forty cubits long and thirty wide. These four in the corners were the same size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a wall around in them, around the four, and boiling places were made under the walls all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “These are the boiling houses, where the ministers of the house shall boil the sacrifice of the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought me back to the door of the temple; and behold, waters flowed out from under the threshold of the temple eastward, for the front of the temple faced toward the east. The waters came down from underneath, from the right side of the temple, on the south of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me out by the way of the gate northward, and led me around by the way outside to the outer gate, by the way of the gate that looks toward the east. Behold, waters ran out on the right side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man went out eastward with the line in his hand, he measured one thousand cubits, and he caused me to pass through the waters, waters that were to the ankles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he measured one thousand, and caused me to pass through the waters, waters that were to the knees. Again he measured one thousand, and caused me to pass through waters that were to the waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward he measured one thousand; and it was a river that I could not pass through, for the waters had risen, waters to swim in, a river that could not be walked through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?”
Then he brought me and caused me to return to the bank of the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when I had returned, behold, on the bank of the river were very many trees on the one side and on the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “These waters flow out toward the eastern region and will go down into the Arabah. Then they will go toward the sea and flow into the sea which will be made to flow out; and the waters will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen that every living creature which swarms, in every place where the rivers come, will live. Then there will be a very great multitude of fish; for these waters have come there, and the waters of the sea will be healed, and everything will live wherever the river comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen that fishermen will stand by it. From En Gedi even to En Eglaim will be a place for the spreading of nets. Their fish will be after their kinds, as the fish of the great sea, exceedingly many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But its swamps and marshes will not be healed. They will be given up to salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the river banks, on both sides, will grow every tree for food, whose leaf won’t wither, neither will its fruit fail. It will produce new fruit every month, because its waters issue out of the sanctuary. Its fruit will be for food, and its leaf for healing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Yahweh says: “This shall be the border by which you shall divide the land for inheritance according to the twelve tribes of Israel. Joseph shall have two portions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall inherit it, one as well as another; for I swore to give it to your fathers. This land will fall to you for inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This shall be the border of the land:
“On the north side, from the great sea, by the way of Hethlon, to the entrance of Zedad;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim (which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath), to Hazer Hatticon, which is by the border of Hauran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border from the sea shall be Hazar Enon at the border of Damascus; and on the north northward is the border of Hamath. This is the north side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The east side, between Hauran, Damascus, Gilead, and the land of Israel, shall be the Jordan; from the north border to the east sea you shall measure. This is the east side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The south side southward shall be from Tamar as far as the waters of Meriboth Kadesh, to the brook, to the great sea. This is the south side southward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The west side shall be the great sea, from the south border as far as opposite the entrance of Hamath. This is the west side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you shall divide this land to yourselves according to the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
